title: The Veronicas' Jessica Origliasso shares a touching tribute to mum Colleen, 71
text:
The Veronicas have long been open about how their mother's battle with dementia impacts their family.

And on Monday, Jessica Origliasso took to Instagram to share a sweet snap alongside her loving mum Colleen, 71.

'Mother's Day every single day with my hero & my best friend. I really love this photo of us hanging out yesterday,' she captioned the snap.

'Everyday should be Mother's Day': The Veronicas' Jessica Origliasso (right) shared a heartwarming tribute to mum Colleen, 71, (left) who is battling Lewy body dementia

She went on to say: 'We had the best time laughing at my puppy breaking out of mama's room. She is the most beautiful woman in the universe.'

The 34-year-old twin sister Lisa, was quick to comment underneath the snap.

She wrote: 'My two,' along with a series of heart emojis.

Dementia battle: Jessica Origliasso has shared a heartbreaking Instagram post about the pain of watching her 71-year-old mother Colleen (centre) lose her mobility and forget who she is

Jessica and Lisa's mother has Lewy body dementia, which causes her thinking, memory and movement to slowly deteriorate.

Back in August, The Hook Me Up hit-maker shared a snap alongside her mum, along with the caption: 'You wake up every single day with a deeply broken heart that you know will never heal'.

'There is no experience or heartbreak before it that can ever prepare you.

'You are my hero and the strongest soul I've ever known': Back in January, Jessica (left) shared another heartfelt tribute to her mother (right) on her 71st birthday

'Watching someone you are deeply in love with and care for, faced with their own mortality is a pain I struggle to find the words to express.'

Jessica explained that social media posts only scratch the surface of her pain, and thanked her family and boyfriend Kai Carlton for their support.

'Grieving for someone who is still alive requires great perspective,' she wrote. 'I am so proud of the strength my sister and dad show every single day.'

Supportive: Jessica said that her boyfriend Kai Carlton (right) had provided her with a 'safe space to share my daily grieving'

Lisa and Jessica became Dementia Australia ambassadors after their mother Colleen's diagnosis.

Colleen was finally told she has Lewy body dementia after four years of being misdiagnosed by doctors, who insisted she had anxiety and depression.

Her twin daughters explained that Colleen was hesitant to break the news to them because of the 'fear and confusion' surrounding dementia.

The sisters previously said: 'It's a difficult thing for anyone going through that diagnosis; that range of emotions that their body has failed them in some way and not understanding how.'
description: The Veronicas have long been open about how their mother's battle with dementia impacts their family.
authors: Shive Prema For Daily Mail Australia
